title: Static Planck stars from effective loop quantum gravity
abstract:
Effective loop quantum gravity dynamics are derived for spherically symmetric
spacetimes with a perfect fluid matter content. For homogeneous spacetimes, the
effective dynamics agree with the standard results of loop quantum cosmology,
while the equations for static solutions give an effective
Tolman-Oppenheimer-Volkoff equation. There exist solutions to the effective
Tolman-Oppenheimer-Volkoff equation that have a mass of the order of the Planck
mass, a Planckian radius, and no horizon; these miniature stars could
potentially contribute to dark matter, and could be an end state for an
evaporating black hole.
